newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: SOCCER-MARADONA SAYS WILL NOT TRAIN EVERY DAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MARADONA SAYS WILL NOT TRAIN EVERY DAY.

text.p: Former Argentina captain Diego Maradona said on Monday he would not accept the condition that he had to train every day if he wanted to rejoin Boca Juniors.
"(I'm) not mad...I cannot do it. If I train every day I will die," he said on television.
The Argentine press have reported that Boca executives have demanded that the 36-year-old former World Cup captain train every day if he is to rejoin Boca.
Maradona said he needed about a month to be in shape. "But I will accept no pressures to train," he said.
Maradona played his last game with Boca in August 1996.
